message.content: This question requires knowledge about different respiratory systems and how organisms breathe. Gills are the respiratory organs used by aquatic organisms to extract oxygen from water. Option (A) is correct because hermit crabs, being marine animals, use gills to breathe. Option (B) is incorrect because humans, being terrestrial creatures, breathe through lungs. Option (C) is incorrect because while blue whales are marine mammals, they have lungs and breathe air, not gills. Option (D) is incorrect because bluebirds, being birds, have lungs and breathe air, not gills.

This question requires basic knowledge about different organisms and their respiratory systems. A hermit crab uses gills to breathe and obtain oxygen from the water. Option (B) is incorrect because humans use lungs to breathe. Option (C) is incorrect because blue whales are mammals that breathe air using lungs. Option (D) is incorrect because bluebirds are also birds that have lungs and breathe air.

This question requires knowledge about different breathing mechanisms in different organisms. Gills are specialized organs that allow aquatic animals to extract oxygen from the water. Option (A) is correct because hermit crabs are aquatic creatures that use gills to breathe underwater. Option (B) is incorrect because humans have lungs instead of gills and breathe air. Option (C) is incorrect because blue whales are marine mammals that have blowholes instead of gills and breathe air. Option (D) is incorrect because bluebirds are birds and have lungs, not gills, for respiration.

This question requires knowledge about different respiratory adaptations in animals. Gills are respiratory organs found in aquatic animals that allow them to extract oxygen from water. Only option (A), the hermit crab, is an aquatic animal that uses gills to breathe. Options (B) and (C) are incorrect because humans and blue whales do not have gills and use lungs instead. Option (D) is incorrect because bluebirds are terrestrial birds and also use lungs for respiration.

Option (A), the hermit crab, is an aquatic animal that uses gills to breathe underwater. Options (B) and (D) are incorrect because humans and birds have lungs instead of gills and rely on breathing air. Option (C), the blue whale, is a marine mammal that has lungs and breathes air at the water's surface, so it does not use gills to breathe.
